conclusion: Understanding the problem involves a particle moving along the x-axis with a graph of x vs. t².
The graph is a straight line decreasing from (0,6) to (2,0).
The graph suggests x is linearly related to t².
Equation of the line is x = m*t² + b.
From the graph, b = 6 when t² = 0.
At t² = 2, x = 0, leading to m = -3.
m should have units of acceleration (m/s²).
Comparing x = m*t² + b to x = x₀ + (1/2)*a*t² gives m = (1/2)*a.
Solving for a gives a = -6 m/s², magnitude is 6 m/s².
Acceleration is the second derivative of position with respect to time.
First derivative v = -6*t, second derivative a = -6 m/s².
Using x = x₀ + (1/2)*a*t² with given values confirms a = -6 m/s².
